Reviews.Title: “Great Value and clean!”
Reviews.Author: STEPHANIE C
Reviews.Content: we turned up in san diego with no reservation and got a great deal here. $50 for the night big clean room, nice bathroom. Great budget accomodation with good free wifi. The waffle spot was awesome for breakie too! location worked for us as we had a car, not sure if it would be much good without own transport.

Reviews.Title: “spring break”
Reviews.Author: ROBERT V
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and have nothing bad to say about it. The staff was great and helpful with directions and any question i had. my kids loved the pool as my wife and i loved the heated hot tub after a long drive to san diego.Its located really close to sea world and surrounding attractions, it has two great restaurants on site which we only did the waffle house ( really good waffles), and there were several restuarants in the area for other choices. As you read other comments here the only suggestion i have and did leave with them is that the only thing missing in the rooms is a mini refrigerator.that is the only thing missing that i can think of, other than thatlike i said great service, rooms were properly cleaned, and for a family on a budget it was a great place to crash. I will stay here again when we go back to san diego.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Ravelstaff
Reviews.Content: We recently had a tragic loss in our family and I decided to distract and cheer my wife up a bit by taking her to see some of the museums at Balboa Park, San Diego, yesterday. We booked the accommodation at Kings Inn on the same web site where we purchased the Balboa Park Stay-for-the-Day Passes. We prepaid the accommodation and Passes and received a confirmation email showing nothing was due at check in at the hotel (the email clearly showed $0 due at check-in in black and white). We arrived at approximately 4:45 p.m. after spending a very relaxing day at the museums and attempted to book in for our stay. The staff informed us that they would need to place a charge against our credit card for $25 as a security deposit. We told them that this particular card was “maxed out” and that we would prefer to pay the deposit in cash. They refused and said that they did not handle cash at all and that their policy is to charge a card. My wife pointed out to them that they had a sign up that said they accepted cash upon check out, presumably for outstanding balances. The assistant, Ana, said that they could not complete the check in without charging the card regardless of this fact. I asked to see the manager but was told that she was not available. When I asked why they then had a sign on the counter that said "Manager on Duty", they again just said she was unavailable; no explanation, no reasonable “she had to step out to deal with a family emergency” or something like that, just No. When we showed them that our confirmation e-mail showed that nothing was due at check in at the hotel, she just said it is wrong and started reading through the fine print to find a loophole. When she could not find anything, she said that the booking agent was wrong and simply went back to her “I won’t budge on this” position. I entirely understand that they wanted to charge a security deposit to ensure that they can cover minor, accidental damages to a room or property if something happened. I have stayed in a *lot* of hotels, both domestically and internationally and I have never, not once, had damage to a room or hotel property. Yet, I do not have a problem with them wanting to cover their bases just in case and we were entirely willing to pay the deposit, just in cold, hard cash not a charge to the card. Instead, because of their inflexibility and refusal to see reason on something this absurd, we decided to have them reverse the room charge back to our card and drive the hour and a bit back home and go out for dinner to our favorite sushi restaurant instead. It amazes me how customer service has deteriorated to the point where someone would turn good business away because of a policy that nobody would dare to think logically about with sense and reason. Because of this, they lost a night's room revenue, as well as whatever we would have paid for dinner, for no good reason. To make it worse there was no manager that we could talk to and we were simply turned away point blank. No discussion, no reasonableness, no customer service, period. Even the travel agent we booked the hotel and purchased the Balboa Passes through was shocked when we phoned them to confirm that the hotel reversed the room charges; the agent said she has never heard of something like this and would be taking it up with her manager as well because it may reflect badly on their services. Other reviewers have posted similar reviews at a different review site about being turned away last year, I cannot help but think this is something that has been happening for a while and they have not seen the need to change it. We come to San Diego relatively frequently because we live about a 90 minutes' drive north and find it is a great place to go for impulsive, short notice breakaways for romantic or de-stressing weekend getaways. It is a downright shame how bad customers are treated these days because nobody is allowed to think anymore, especially in this economy. I wonder what their policy would have been had we been international travelers using just traveler’s checks. My advice to all travelers would be to look elsewhere and stay far away from bad customer service like this. I am sure that Kings Inn might possibly have lived up to the good reviews on several web sites that we saw, but we definitely did not see it or have the chance to experience it. Stay away and take your business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Value & Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jenmccann72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 7 year old twins over spring break. What a great find! Right on Hotel Circle in San Diego, close to everything. Freeway, shopping, all the major attractions & of course the beach! Hotel staff was very friendly & very helpful. Two nice restaurants on site. Heated pool & hot tub right outside our door. Grounds were kept spotless by maintenance people. I decided to extend our stay & the front desk beat the online price of Priceline & Expedia. Very pleased & will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “great price great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: dont let the exterior fool you, this is a great hotel for the money. close to everything and the wafflespot is a great place to get breakfast on site. they are in the process of remodeling the rooms to update them but even the older rooms are as clean as they can be. the staff is euper nice and friendly. if youre looking for a good location at a reasonable price this it it

Reviews.Title: “hotels not great but staff nice”
Reviews.Author: ORLA77
Reviews.Content: rooms small with musty smell tiny bathroom.. good location and staff helpful and nice. cheap rate

Reviews.Title: “One big "but"....”
Reviews.Author: mikesurfer
Reviews.Content: I too do not understand the negarive reviews, as in many ways this is a very nice property. The Kiings Inn on Hotel Circle is a vintage "California Style" Property in that many of the rooms wrap around a very pretty pool area, with towering palm trees, some of which are spotlighted at night. Best of all, the pool is actually heated to a comfy temperature.....I get really tired of hotel pools reminiscent of the film "Ice Station Zebra" but this one is wonderfully warm at least most of the year. The beds are not "lumpy" but are very comfy, though the pillows are tired, to be polite. One big caution is that the bathroom is verrrrry cramped, with tight access--the property cant change this, as even most mid-century houses had smaller bathrooms than one finds now--just be prepared, as there is no way to accomodate a wheelchair, at least in the rooms I have had, for example. Parking runs through the complex, so one is usually parked close to the room. Yes, there is a computer in the Lobby for Guest use......kinda chintzy as most properties have a computer that is free for guests, but this one costs and it's cash only. The big "BUT" is that the rooms do not have refrigerators, and so many competitors now do supply an in-room refrig. So be warned--you may miss cold soft drinks in the room, etc/ All in all, a lovely mid-century property with a great pool, comfy beds, and very friendly front desk......just dont bring home restaurant leftovers or soda drinks as no refrig.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: This was a normal hotel and for a short stay it's a good place to stay. I don't know why people give it such bad reviews. The staff was extremely friendly, the location is great and the rooms were comfortable. The king bed was amazingly comfortable and I would probably stay here again just to sleep in the bed. The only downfall was the small bathroom, and it was small. There was good scenery and a nice heated pool and hot tub. Definitely would recommend to anyone wanting to stay in San Diego for a couple days.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: phongthevu
Reviews.Content: Well, I was back in Sand Diego again and this time I stayed at Kings Inn in San Diego right off freeway 8 and between freeway 805 and the 5. As you can tell by the name, it is an inn not a hotel. I wasn't expecting it to be any better than 3 stars but surprisingly, it was better than the last motel I stayed at. Please read my prior review for more details. What attracted me was the manager's special during the weekdays. A king size bed with pool view was 50% off plus you you get coupons to their own restaurants. Like most other hotels, this inn is pretty close to the freeway but I did not hear any noise from my room. The pool and jacuzzi are heated. Even though I didn't go in, I did put my hand into the pool to make sure the the water is heated as advertised on their website. The room was fair with heating and ac by the window. However, air unit is automatic once you set your temperature on the digital thermostat. There is a small coffee table with two lounge chairs and a ceiling light hanging right above it. It simulates a bistro or a lounge. There is a fair size flat panel TV, most likely LCD, with basic cable. The bathroom is not so spacious. Tub shower and toilet is in its separate room while the sink is outside. Other amenities such as hair dryer, ice, vending machines, basic cable, and wifi is present. When I come down to San Diego, I don't plan to spend much time in the hotel. I spend most of the time doing things and going places, and the hotel is just a place for me to put my luggage and rest through the night. That's why I don't need an expensive place to sleep. I would recommend this place for people who just need a night rest with little noise, fairly inexpensive, and close proximity to many popular sites. With the special, I paid less than $60 per night and that includes all taxes. I hope you see this review helpful. Thanks Happy travels, Anthony

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: craigbert
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we wanted to save a little bit of money on a short one-night stay and because it got decent reviews. From the outside and lobby it looks like not much has changed since the late 60s. But our room was quite nice. It was older but clean and comfortable. The best part was it was clean. The hot tub was a little disappointing; it wasn't much warmer than the chilly night air. No WiFi issues.

Reviews.Title: “Kings Inn Staycation”
Reviews.Author: jalake
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided that a "staycation" might be nice for a night, so I looked up some deals online and found the Kings Inn for $60/night for a poolside room. The hotel is located in San Diego's Hotel Circle, conveniently off the 8. Not a major deal for us as we're local, but very convenient for access to much of what San Diego has to offer. The hotel is one of the older hotels in the area and as such it does show some signs of wear and tear. If you are concerned about things like some chipped paint or an ill-fitting light fixture, then you might want to shop elsewhere. However, if you want a clean room with friendly service and a great room rate, Kings Inn is an excellent choice. The pool and hot tub area were nice and we took advantage of both. I would certainly stay here again and recommend this hotel to out of town guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, older hotel, good value for you money.”
Reviews.Author: BigLakeCountry
Reviews.Content: Stay for 3 nights, went to a chargers football game. Very good location for football. Hotel is older, but comfortable. Staff are very friendly. It's a little hard to get to if you're heading West on I-8. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lacadien1
Reviews.Content: Old but very clean, has character, small bathroom, quiet, easy access to I-8, excelent value. Didn't try reataurant too many others around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Mariele S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. It is a nice hotel with clean and quiet rooms. Great Shuttle-Service (ask at front desk) for only 20$/4 people to Gas Lamp Quartier / Downtown. It was hard to find the hotel in the first place, but otherwise the location was perfect, we could drive to all the places we wanted to see. One Advice: Don't ask for information on sights or what to do in San Diego at the front desk, they are not interested in helping. In total i can definitely recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Thulfiqar A
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located in a convenient place for me. It was right off the freeway and close to what I came to San Diego. We really did enjoy our time here, the room was clean and tidy. The staff were great and the place was quiet. Would stay here again, especially at the rate that I got it at.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Terrible”
Reviews.Author: TraveLatino
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia's Unpublished Rates Service as the offer was for a 3 star hotel at $75. I've booked 3 and 4 star hotels in San Diego for around that price before so I THOUGHT I was getting a good deal. boy was I in for a surprise!! This was definitely NOT a 3 star hotel. Don't get me wrong, the staff upon check-in was nice. I know others have stated how friendly the staff is. No problems there. However, there is no way this hotel should be listed as 3 star. They try to pass their antiquated furniture of as "Vintage Classic Style". It just means the owner is too cheap to upgrade his furniture from the 70's. The TV is a small 25" that was also purchased decades ago. They don't even provide the standard amenities that ANY quality hotel should provide. There was no iron and ironing board in the room (and it took them an hour to bring me one), there is no in-room coffee service, and there wasn't even a remote control for the Television (apparently there was supposed to be, but when I asked for one to be brought up to my room I was told they didn't have one to bring me). The hotel seems to be VERY family friendly (I'm sure the rates have something to do with it) and you'll be made very aware of it as I could hear kids runnign around and screaming VERY early in the morning. Sound insulation is something that does not exist at this hotel. I could even hear the guy next door snoring when I laid down to go to sleep. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again and am furious at Expedia for selling me this hotel as a 3 star. I could have probably gotten better accommodations at a 2 star hotel for less money!! With all the hotels in the San Diego area, do yourself a favor and DO NOT book this hotel. (unless you're looking for somewhere cheap and have kids and don't mind zero amenities!)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: judyelg
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located on Hotel Circle South. Rooms were clean and comfortable. No breakfast provided but on check-in we were given coupons for discounts at the hotel's two restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “our rooms were clean and good people work at Kings Inn Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: suzie5633388
Reviews.Content: Our first hotel, on our road trip was in Las Vegas. We were put in the back at the manor at circus circus. It was horrible, to say the least. ( AARP booked the hotels for me) I was so happy to see our rooms at Kings Inn , were clean, all out lets worked, and the people that worked at Kings Inn were kind . It is nice to know when we go back....Kings Inn is where we are staying.

Reviews.Title: “An inexpensive option in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl67
Reviews.Content: Okay, I need to start off by saying my rating is based on the fact that we stayed here for a VERY cheap rate. Had I paid more, the rating would've dropped. I've stayed in many nice hotels, but am also comfortable enough in a lower-grade hotel. This hotel is very kitchy, but we sort of just embraced the cheesy atmosphere and enjoyed it. The negatives: The room did smell rather musty, and we ended up buying some Febreeze, which helped immensely. The bathroom was pretty rundown (but clean). We went down to use the spa, but when we dipped a toe in, discovered it was cold. Now for the positives: It was very inexpensive with a reservation through hotels.com. and had free and ample parking. The location is great if you are visiting various areas of San Diego, as it is very central and is safe. The waffles at the Waffle House were fabulous. Lastly, and very importantly, the staff was great. Everyone was extremely helpful and pleasant. If I were visiting the area again and got a great rate, I would return to the King's Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Susaberg
Reviews.Content: This was a clean place, and I would most likely stay at it again. The only thing I didn't like about it was there was sand on the bottom of the pool and spa...and the spa was mediocre...the jets were very lame! Also, keep in mind that there are no elevators for taking your stuff up to the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Simple last minute hotel”
Reviews.Author: 602Traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simple and a last minute decision. Most hotels in Hotel Circle are going to be prime location for all your San Diego needs. I always try to find a hotel here because access is good and the hotels are fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “I'm still grossed out”
Reviews.Author: travel347076
Reviews.Content: I really needed to stay on budget. I chose this hotel because it was very affordable and had high review ratings. It was filthy dirty, the carpet was so dirty, the walls had dried food on them. There are small curtains hanging from the ceiling above the beds and you can see the 3 inches of dust on them, as well as breathe it in too. The plumbing did not work. Staff was nice, location good. I needed a cab ride to the airport for a 6am flight. The staff offered to set it up with a personal driver who charges a flat rate. He no showed! Thankfully another cab company was able to get me to the airport at a moments notice. Was a gross and stressful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to our low standards - filthy carpet, cold "hot" tub, slow wifi”
Reviews.Author: WhitehorseJ
Reviews.Content: We don't have high expectations - on this trip we spend most nights in an old camper van - but even at this price ($56 April mid-week) we were disappointed. When I asked for the AAA discount I was told that the AAA rate was higher. This is a sleazy way of pricing rooms to draw in AAA members without ever honoring the discounts. Room layout and bed comfort were both well enough. The TV was tiny and the main light had to have it's cord jiggled a few times to stay on. Bathroom was clean. The carpet was disgusting - our biggest complaint. It had a strange feel to it on bare feet. When our baby spat up a bit on the floor and we wiped it off with a cloth, the carpet left dark black stains on the cloth. WiFi was terrible. The signal strength was adequate, but the motel's connection itself is severely underpowered and inconsistent. Basic non-multimedia browsing was slow during most of the day and came to a near-halt during peak use in the evening. It took 5 minutes for me to access this review page. The pool was cold - fine for a pool - but the hot tub was barely even a warm tub. We stay at budget motels as a "treat" when we need to get out of the van for a couple nights. We don't have high expectations of budget motels - but at least expect them to be clean and the wifi to work.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap price for a road trip.”
Reviews.Author: BigAlbert323
Reviews.Content: We went for a road trip to San Diego coming from L.A. For the weekend stay. Staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were cosy. Bathroom were small. Im a wide advarage man and Had to lean to the side for the door to open due to the toilet bein right next to door. Need to upgrade for a bigger tv but didn't complain due to having cable. There's not alot of power outlet to charge you phone, computer, camera, ect. Room was clean but had a old smell like Trappicana from Las Vegas good thing I brought my scented candel. The pool was great and as well as the jaquzi. Might have to bring your beach towel. The pool towel are a bit rough. Make sure you eat at the waffle spot for breakfast. The Kigns in was a good place to stay at. Not to far from the city. If your looking for a 5 star hotel you have to Search for something else but if your looking for a decent price to stay in San Diego for that weekend road trip this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for budget travel”
Reviews.Author: Lingyan_Hu
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness - decent; sheets and towels were changed on a daily basis Location - perfect if you drive; free parking, near the highway, average 15 mins to major attractions Room - very basic; no fridge or coffee maker, internet is very very slow though Service - staff seems friendly Sleep quality - ok; our room is at the back, farther away from the highway, and is very quiet; but I found the pillows too soft

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: lesakt
Reviews.Content: It took a long time for me to choose a hotel for our trip to San Diego. We needed a budget hotel that was close to Sea World and the San Diego Zoo. Based on price, location and others' reviews, I chose King's Inn. I was perfectly satisfied with the choice. First off, if you are looking for a luxury room, this is not it. Like other posters have said, the bathroom is small. In fact, if you are a person of size, you might have trouble shutting the door while you are sitting on the toilet. The showerhead is curiously low (I'm only 5'5" and it was short for me) and the water pressure leaves something to be desired. That being said, what was more important to me is cleanliness, and the bathroom was clean. The rooms are dated and the TV is small, but we were not there to hang around in the room all day. The rooms are clean (no sign of bed bugs---I checked!) and I found the beds to be firm but comfy. The front desk staff as well as the restaurant staff (we dined at both in-hotel restaurants: the Amigo Spot and the Waffle Spot) were very friendly and accomodating. We didn't really get a chance to use the pool (too cold at night when we were around), but the hot tub was nice. Though the property is right off the freeway, I didn't notice any real freeway noise as our room faced in toward the pool. One night there was a noisy person outside yelling a bunch, but other than that, the other guests were respectful. There was a mix of both younger folks and older couples as well as few families like ours. All and all, I found that for the money, The King's Inn was a good choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for price paid: clean, comfortable, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Abe18
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake, although I am giving this hotel four stars, this is not a "five-star" or "four-star" hotel. But, this hotel is definitely a cut above other 2 and 3-star facilities. This hotel is the third or fourth oldest in Mission Valley, according to the manager. Built around 1960, its decor is dated, but that is also what gives this venue its charm. More importantly, the rooms are very clean and the staff is exceptionally dedicated to providing its customers with friendly service. We were initially assigned a room in one of the attached buildings. However, the room had a musty odor (possibly due to recent flooding following unusually heavy rains) and was cramped for our family of three. For an additional $10/night we were able to have a room in the main building, which one enters from the inside. (Rooms in the attached buildings are entered directly from outdoors.) This made a huge difference, particularly since it was cool and rainy during much of our stay. Due to special dietary needs, we did not eat in the restaurants, but, for an extra $5/day, we were able to have a refrigerator in the room, which was larger than the usual cube-sized models. The beds were comfortably firm (no significant sagging) and the shower was outstanding. However, this is not a fancy hotel: there are few electrical outlets in the rooms; there is no counter in the bathrooms in the main building on which to place toiletries, and there is no elevator to the second floor. The toilet is an old-style, slow-flush, which often requires two or three flushes to remove paper. Still, for the price paid, these are minor inconveniences. Staff at the reservation desk offered to carry luggage up the steps for me (not needed) and were as knowledgeable as any concierge about how to get to local venues. If you are intent on finding a plush hotel you should look elsewhere; but if you would like to save your money for sightseeing and dining, a clean, comfortable hotel, with a friendly staff, without having to pay high rates, this hotel is the place to go. There is also free Wi-Fi in all of the rooms. Despite not being a true "four-star" hotel, I rate the hotel at this level because of the great value for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Travellers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Mc_SALaD
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and the rooms were clean. Huge carpark. We had breakfast at the Waffle Spot, which was an experience our kids will treasure for years! Easy to navigate from, as the freeway is on the doorstep. Staff very helpful with diections to everything we asked. Interent in lobby. Decor is very original. But clean & friendly wins for our family!

Reviews.Title: “Great motel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: MrTrailhound
Reviews.Content: If your are vacationing in the San Diego area and are looking for a good motel at a great price, try the Kings Inn, located in the Hotel Circle area. My wif and I have loved our stay here. Quality is the most often spoken word here: quality price, quality rooms, quality location and most important quality staff. They have done their best to provide us a comfortable and memorable stay on our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for Budget Conscious”
Reviews.Author: PamAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the Kings Inn Hotel San Diego on two separate occassions when visiting USA from Australia and have found it to be excellent both times. This isn't a 5 star hotel but it is clean and tidy and the rooms have everything in them that you need. It is also moderately priced which is important to us a family travelling. The only downfall if you are fussy is that you have to go to Reception for tea/coffee as there isn't a machine in the rooms. There is a great pool and hot tub and after a day of sightseeing it is nice to relax at night - even in winter! The reception staff are so very helpful when you need advice or directions. They have directions already printed up for all tourist attractions, shopping etc. and if they haven't got it ready they'll quickly do it for you. A great service and one which we really appreciate as international travellers. It is positioned on the Motel Strip and only a quick drive away from anything. We thoroughly recommend Kings Inn Hotel and look forward to our next visit when travelling to or through San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “So Convenient”
Reviews.Author: qhappy
Reviews.Content: We have been going to San Diego for years! We love Kings Inn. I'm sure if there is something room with your room - you just need to tell the front desk. We love the Waffle Spot and Amigo dining and a steak house is just across the street. For the price you can't beat it. It's convenient lots of parking. The not the front desk person, but the actual manager is terrific. If you see him, he is friendly and helpful. They have specials on the internet so check there first! It's not 5 stars. But you can save the difference and spend it on shopping.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: familyfun5280
Reviews.Content: Okay...I read the previous reviews and thought this would be a good hotel for a family on a budget. I wish that I would have spent more money. First thing to consider is that there is no free breakfast, which I knew, but paying for breakfast every morning adds up and breakfast at the hotel is not cheap. There have been rave reviews about the breakfast on property, but I found it average and overpriced. We went to the local Denny's which was better and less expensive. Bottom line is factor in the price of breakfast when making your decision on which hotel to stay at if you are on a budget. So, check-in went well. We checked in at about 1030pm and were the only ones in there and were treated nicely. Went to the room and found that it had a wired smell. Probably because it was old and outdated. The chairs were so stained and filthy that if they were in my house they would have been placed in the trash years ago. The television was small and old, the and the bathroom had no ventilation. The linens seemed to be clean and the housekeeping service was good. Something that was hard to get past was the filthy carpets! We have two little kids who like to roll around and play on the floor and it was gross. No joke if you walked around barefoot and stood in the bathtub there would be black...I mean black footprints. I also saw the biggest bug on the floor and it crawled beneath the bed before I could get it. It seriously looked like something in an alien movie. It was 4 inches long and fast, didn't tell my wife or she would have freaked out. Kids love the pool, but this pool was cold and tasted like salt water. We went once and I could not handle a second try. There were some sketchy patrons at the hotel. Hate to say it but I would not be surprised if more than a few drug deals occurred there during our stay. The location was not bad. It was right off of the highway and seemed to be a safe location near many other hotels. There is a general store about a mile away to buy some food if you want, but there is no place in the room to keep the food cold. So, in closing if all I said would not bother you then stay there. I do plan on going to San Diego again, but I promise you that I will not stay there again. I will gladly pay the extra money to stay at a nicer and cleaner place. I was surprised by how much a hotel can effect your perception of a city and your vacation even if your only sleeping there.

Reviews.Title: “MY MISTAKE”
Reviews.Author: mral5
Reviews.Content: This is TAMMY and i recently wront a good review on priceline regarding the hotel BY MISTAKE because it was meant for HOLIDAY INN. I wouldn't stay at kings inn again because the room was very outdated and the two chairs in the room where very stained. The bathroom was too small & you had to either straddle the toilet or stand in the tub to close the bathroom door. It was good for the cheap price i paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: dantheman_nz
Reviews.Content: The staff were polite and quite helpful, we couldn't check-in two hours early with explanation and pointed us things to see in downtown until 3pm. The room itself is adequately sized, with the exception of the bathroom which is quite small, maybe this is common for American hotels? There were enough room for the three of us. There is a coffee machine at reception area next to the waffle restaurant. Swimming pool looks quite good however I didn't try getting in as the weather was quite cold when we were there. There was always people in the swimming people (kids) during opening hours as this property is geared for the family market. Location-wise is quite strange as 'hotel circle' isn't too close to downtown, and involved getting in and out of the freeways over short distances.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: Pop-upPrincess
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Kings Inn on numerous occasions in the last two years visiting relatives in the area. The rooms are always clean and well maintained. While it is an older property, the owners keep things freshly painted and the linens are of better quality. There is a coffee shop on site and a lovely pool and spa. Recently an error in billing was discovered after we got home and the hotel quickly responded with a credit based on a call I made. They get high marks for honoring their rates even though I have missed the problem at check out. The rates are cheaper on the internet so be sure to reserve your room ahead of time. Hotel is located near an I-8 on ramp and has convenient access to the shopping malls in Mission Valley and Fashion Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: dwolfman
Reviews.Content: We spent several days in San Diego to attend our oldest son's graduation from the Marine Corps and to enjoy San Diego for a couple of days. The Kings Inn was picked primarily for location (very close to a lot of great places) and price (cheaper than most). The room was definitely a bit on the old side and in need of an update in carpet and furniture. But it was clean and comfortable. We hit the pool several times and enjoyed it quite a bit. It was clean as well - and a lot of fun. The staff at the hotel were first class and went out of their way to help us in any way they could. They had a ton of useful information and were always cheerful. A great staff. No review of the hotel is complete though without mentioning the restaurants. WE ate breakfast there every morning and the food was outstanding, Probably the best waffles I have had in my life. Everyone agrees that breakfast there was a high point of the trip. And we did eat dinner one night at the Mexican restaurant in the hotel. This was after two nights in a row eating a good Mexican places in Old Town. We all agreed that the hotel Mexican restaurant was better than either of the Old Town places we ate. And we are from an area with lots of good Mexican food so we know Mexican. If we are in San Diego again we will definitely stay at the Kings Inn again....

Reviews.Title: “Fine Inn. Fine Price.”
Reviews.Author: fairyofairy
Reviews.Content: The Inn's outside structure wasn't too appealing, but the inside design was good enough. The staff were every friendly. They take time to explain all your needs. The room was somewhat small, but it was very clean. The pools were heated. However, the Inn should have a liveguard watching the pools, but it didn't have one. people would say that a place right next to the freeway is noisy, but i like hearing the sound of cars passing by while i'm sleeping. Overall, good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Staff, in a Great Location--Enough said!”
Reviews.Author: sleepingdani
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, comfortable room and friendly staff--this is the place for you! My Family and I stayed here for a week as we toured San Diego. It is only minutes from the zoo, from the Beach, from shopping---the location is A++++. The rooms are simple but clean. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The pool is clean and beautiful---9 ft deep which my daughter and other children there loved. The Waffle Spot has AWESOME Coffee and good breakfasts. The wifi isn't always easy to connect but if you came to San Diego to surf the net---your missing out. The Laundry room was perfect since we packed light. The value here is great as we only needed simple lodging as we were sightseeing most of every day. I was pleasantly surprised at the value and I cannot say enough about the 5 star staff. We will definatly go back as soon as we are able---This hotel made our trip possible and memorable!

Reviews.Title: “WORST, STINK, DONT STAY THERE”
Reviews.Author: maiy
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my kids while transferring to my new job. the room was cold, heater did not work, they transfer me to another room, heater did not work again. they gave me a portable heater which was dangerous with a child in the room. loud since it was right by the freeway. the most loud partygoers were there. horrible experience room stinks like wet dog. i would not stay there even if it was FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Good waffles. Tasty margaritas.”
Reviews.Author: bumhip
Reviews.Content: We liked our stay at the hotel. We did not run into any problems. A lot of people where saying you get what you pay for and i suppose that is true. But that wasn't a bad thing when i stayed there recently. The hotel was nice. It was clean. The restaurant, The Amigo Spot was good. We were given a 15% coupon. The tamarind margarita looked really odd but was quite tasty. The one bad thing. The hotel rooms do have thin walls. That would be my biggest complaint. We could hear the television from the room next door. And when we flushed the toilets it was really loud in our room for a minute. But we had a nice, free breakfast the next morning. The waffles were good and the wait staff was friendly. You do get what you pay for and we had a very nice stay at this cute hotel. If you want to be pampered then pay more and stay at a different hotel. They even have a laundry room. didnt use it but they have one.

Reviews.Title: “OK for value/location”
Reviews.Author: alleeeeee
Reviews.Content: Great location and our kids loved the on-site breakfast restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Older, but very clean and people friendly”
Reviews.Author: monthlytravler
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 9/28 to 10/03/09 We asked and received a room in back facing the pool. It was quiet (Can be road noisy in the front) The rooms were very clean, the king bed was very comfortable, the pool was clean and so were the tables and chairs. The free breakfast was a waffle, eggs bacon or sausage, juice or coffee. It was very tasty, but a little variety would help. The Amigo Spot restaurant had great food. It was about 10 minutes from the airport and old town,15 to Balboa Park . We will definately stay her again. Jerry

Reviews.Title: “Good value, that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: TonyLINY
Reviews.Content: It had a bed, a bathroom, television, pool and hot tub on the property. Good enough. Not the nicest hotel by far but it was located a short drive to Old Town, Gas Lamp, Fashion Center, and Balboa Park. For the location, the price was right. The pool was nice and the restaurant on the premesis served a good breakfast. I wasn't there for the luxury, just to go for a swim at night and sleep. The rooms definitely could use an update.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location - Terrible Bed”
Reviews.Author: sistasallysue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling to San Diego and just did a one night stay, so we were looking for a place to rest our head for the night. The value was great, we booked the room under $75. Don't expect any amenities other than slow Wi-Fi and Cable TV. They don't even have extra pillows or comforters. They do have a pool. The room had a weird scent, almost the scent of smoke, but not quite. The bed was HARD AS A ROCK. I'm a very good sleeper, I can get a good night's rest on the floor, and I guess I should have done that here, because the floor would have been more comfortable than this bed! The waffle spot is ok, a little pricey. I ordered the toasted pecan waffle combo, which means a regular waffle that's left in about a minute longer with raw pecans sprinkled on top. Hubby order the banana nut waffle which meant a regular waffle with bananas and walnuts sprinkled on top. These are NOT specialized waffles! Coffee was also horrible, definitely do breakfast somewhere else. If you're looking for some general late night fun, the hotel is about 3 miles from a Dave & Busters, and conveniently located close to the harbor and balboa park.

Reviews.Title: “"Don't let the bed bugs bite!"”
Reviews.Author: Travis_matte
Reviews.Content: If you want to test the old addage about bed bugs biting you in your sleep. Check yourself into room 220 at the Kings Inn Hotel, located at Hotel circle in San Diego CA. To start, the room was old and musty and smelled like my Grandmother's sock drawer. The color of the carpet was such that if there were stains, ( and I am 100% certain that there were,) you could not see them because it was the color of 12 day old cream of broccoli soup. The night was short because we got to sleep around 3am, and checked out at 11am the next morning. but that did not detour the resident insects from invading our slumber and planting their nasty little fangs in our pasty Midwestern flesh. If you have any doubt about what I am telling you, take a look at the pictures I have posted for your viewing pleasure. Both myself and my friend had these nasty bed bug bites and we both feel like we were violated in our sleep by the those nasty little creatures. So if you ever find yourself rolling down I8 and falling asleep at the wheel, just keep driving. You might end up in the hospital, but at least their sheets are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Smelly Cramped”
Reviews.Author: chris_91773
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dark. They smelled stale. The bathroom was cramped. The beds were hard like plywood. The back windows looked upon a homeless camp. My wife's ring was stolen by cleaning staff. The hotel made no apologies and no attempt to rectify the issue. I would not stay here again. I would not recommend it to a friend . . . maybe an enemy.

Reviews.Title: “More than meets expectations”
Reviews.Author: mrkwong
Reviews.Content: Architecturally unimpressive, about as Old English as Round Table Pizza, classic 1972 motor lodge architecture, from the street you won't think much. Don't be fooled. It's not luxurious, it's not a resort with lush grounds and it's obviously an old property but it's cleaner and better-maintained than a lot of places twice as costly, the beds are comfy, everything works, no funky plumbing, no squealing vent fans. The pool is in good shape and clean, the restaurants are good and reasonable value (our three-year-old daughter loved the mariachis in the Mexican place.) If the location meets your needs and you're realistic about your expectations you'll be pleasantly surprised and you can't beat it for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the price”
Reviews.Author: superwoman_200
Reviews.Content: This place was a good deal and my husband and I were just looking for a clean place to sleep while in San Diego. It was perfect for that, but the TV was a little fuzzy and the room was really old school! It looked like it was from the 50s but it was clean and worked great for us. The biggest downside was no breakfast unless you want to pay about $8-$10 a person. Overall, it was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but think twice about getting the breakfast special with your reservation.”
Reviews.Author: Loisr
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel. It was clean and well maintained. Even the hand towels were folded into an elegant fan shape. We could not hear any noise coming through the walls to the adjoining rooms, which was nice. Couldn't hear any street noise either. The beds were comfortable. We purchased a special which included breakfast, but as it turned out we HAD to have the waffle special each day that we were there. We couldn't order anything else unless we wanted to forfeit the $5 we had already paid for each breakfast. They have lots of items on their menu so don't get the $5 breakfast special in advance unless you're sure you will only want a waffle, bacon and 2 eggs.

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for the 5-star traveler, but you probably wouldn't expect that. My travel companion booked this hotel well advised. The security on the property turned out to be very good, even calling us late at night when I left the light in my car on. So I was impressed with that angle, especially considering the proximity to the highway and the border. Overall, the rooms are very spartan. It's everything you'd expect from a Days Inn, Travelodge kind of property. There are no frills. The pool looks about 20 years old. The front desk staff was pleasant, helpful, and efficient, but not experts on the area. Old Town is close by and you're on the freeway for easy access to other places. Personally it's not my cup of tea but not bad considering what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buy For The $$$$ in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: CALTEX50
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Kings Inn many times on business and pleasure trips to San Diego. These are the facts, friend. Excellent pricing. Great location Large rooms with great beds. Large pool with a resort feel. 2 good restuarants on site. The kind of personal service you hope to find in a 5 star hotel. Ricco and Macarena are the best (visualize capital letters here)! Plus the best piano bar in the world is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: redhills
Reviews.Content: We paid $45/night through Priceline for a three night stay; would not have wanted to pay more. However, this is cheap for a hotel in San Diego. We found the room was clean, newly painted, average motel type bedding, wireless ok. Pool area is adequate--better then some motels I have stayed in. If you get a good rate, just want a place to sleep, this is not a bad choice. No in room coffee or continental breakfast; coffee provided in lobby. Did not use hotel restaurant. Some noise from guests arriving late; cars right outside the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: jonlite
Reviews.Content: Got dumped in here after a cancelled flight with United! Have stayed in San Diego quite a lot..........but DON'T go here!!!The rooms were dark and smelly, it didn't seem safe after dark, and it's too close to the Freeway. Spend a bit more, and get a good night's sleep somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: bren13
Reviews.Content: The room was nice.The outlets would not hold plug ins. I felt uncomfortable due to all of the men hanging around outside on the balcony everynight being loud. The t.v. was staticy most of the time, I called front desk about channels, she said that she would bring me a new channel guide & never did. I ordered pizza one night from the flyer in the doors, food order wrong & never got reimbursed. Called front desk & they said they have notification reference not ordering from them due to they operate out of their garage illegally. Nice!!! I then looked at front desk & it's on a 3X3 paper that you wouldn't even see. I am sure they would not eat from there so why would they let their guests!! I did go to the Amigo Spot for supper one night. Service was fair. I wrote all this information on my card & left it at the front desk. I have not heard from them, so I would say poor customer service on their part overall. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a little dirty”
Reviews.Author: Marinda0
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms and stayed 2 nights. The hotel is located very close to Seaport Village, San Diego Zoo, SeaWorld, etc... It is comparable to an Econolodge or lower grade motel. When I first walked into the room, it was very dark and smelled very stuffy. I had to air out the room. It appears to be a pretty old hotel, and I questioned how clean the dark green carpet and later learned from my friends who stayed in the other room that the carpet would turn your white socks or feet black. I recommend bringing a pair of slippers/sandals to wear around the room and not to go barefoot. You can hear noise from the adjointing room and when the shower is running in the adjacent rooms. On the positive note, the service was great, and the bed seemed clean. We had breakfast at The Waffle Spot and loved it. I personally wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for Value”
Reviews.Author: maya_mommy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly because of the price. We were in San Diego for a wedding. I read all the reviews before going to San Diego, so I knew what to expect. I brought a room freshner with me, to deal with the smell (which was not as bad as I had imagined it would be). The beds were hard, but they are the same as any other lower budget hotel. The room decor seemed out of date, until we went to a friend's hotel in Coronado... ours was wonderful compared to theirs. There was a full tub in our room which was great, as no other guests at the wedding who booked elsewhere had tubs in their rooms. The room was cleaned very well each day. No bugs, no noise issues. The only problem I had was the hair blower did not work in my room. All of the friends who visited our room were very surprised that for the price we paid, we got a nicer room then they did, and they paid twice the amount we did! If we ever go again, I would be willing to stay 50% of the time at this hotel. I would stay the other 50% on Coronado Island, as I think it is well worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjonathan2
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel Aug 25-27, 2008 for my birthday with the kids and I have to say for the rate it was great and the rooms were very nice looking it looks like they were upgraded and the bathroom were all nice. The kids enjoyed the pool area which you can see from your room. The restaraunts had pretty good waffles and mexican food. overall I will come back to this hotel again next year and everyone was friendly at the hotel. Do not let the outside appearence fool you. The only downside is no microwave or fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CarlaHereford
Reviews.Content: After such good reviews on tripadvisor, we were very disappointed with this hotel. It was basic with dark and dingey rooms in need of refurbishment. The bathroom was tiny. The woodwork was dark and sticky and walking barefooted on the carpets left our feet dirty. On a positive note, the staff were friendly and the pool suited the kids. However, for the money, we could have got much better.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: jijimaro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremly bad there is a horrible strong smell of Mold, I couldn't sleep the whole night. In the morning They changed us to a different room and the clerk said that lot of room are like that and people complain, I really think that the city needs to close that place.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: VipB
Reviews.Content: Like a previous review stated, you get what you pay for. I paid around $75 for one night and could not have expected anything better for that price. The only real complain I have is that the bed was extremely firm. This hotel is a great option for a couple nights at the most, but you should probably look elsewhere if you want to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: FrugalDreamer
Reviews.Content: You know the old adage… you get what you pay for? This holds true for the Kings Inn. San Diego is an expensive place to stay so we were hoping this would be a decent option for the budget traveler. The price was right but I probably wouldn’t stay there again. We spent the Saturday night of Memorial Day weekend there as our eldest daughter was graduating from college. That night was also prom night and (at least) four rooms in our vicinity were booked by high schoolers boozing and swearing most of the night, partying with the doors open. I called the front desk in the wee hours of the morning and was told they’d send security to check on it. The next morning we ate breakfast at the on-site Waffle Spot (just ok, nothing special) and saw carloads of high school seniors checking out. Unfortunately, I’m a light sleeper and I found this hotel (and its guests) to be quite noisy both late at night and at the crack of dawn. The parking area echoes so voices are amplified through the non-soundproof rooms. One plus that attracted me to the hotel is it’s nonsmoking. On the downside, tons of folks were smoking outside our room section, apparently in violation of the hotel’s policy. The room was rather dark and dingy but the bed was surprisingly comfortable – even though the sheets were the wrong size. Lighting is poor in the room and the TV is very small. I did like having a window at the back that we could open to get fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: bostonSkT
Reviews.Content: Booked 6 nights @ this hotel for vacation. We chose this hotel because the user reviews were good, and it was quite cheap. Upon arrival, there was no parking; I had to park on the other side of the hotel, far from the room. The lobby was dark and dreary, however the front desk employee was very friendly. When we got to the room I was more than disappointed. The room was dark, smelled musty, and was incredibly small. Everything looked old, and not very well cleaned. The carpet was dark and not clean, the closet shelf had paint peeling, and the shower still had hair in it.... gross. The sink had almost no room to put our toiletries, and the bathroom was so small that i had to step into the tub so I could shut the door behind me. Even the TV was tiny, looked like a 13" or so.. To get an iron & hairdryer I had to go to the front desk - Looked like these items have been through a couple wars. We really didn't feel comfortable staying in those beds after looking over the rest of the room -- but it was late so we got some sleep, on top of the covers. The next morning I immediately went online and found a different hotel, I drove down to the Ramada Plaza (only 1/4 mile down the road) and they let me view the rooms before making the reservation. We checked out of the Kings Inn and called Orbitz for a refund. The rest of the stay @ Ramada Plaza was very nice, and very affordable. The one highlight is the front desk staff, they were always very polite, and in the morning when I checked out she was apologetic. If only the hotel matched the staff, that place would do alright.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: canadatravel1
Reviews.Content: There is BLACK MOLD for sure even thou it's not visible, may be in carpet or ventilation system. Since I am very sensitive to it, my asthma attack started in 10 min after I entered the room. We had to move out immediately. My husband , who is in good health, was coughing for a few hours even after we moved out. We checked another room, but the smell was the same throughout the motel.

Reviews.Title: “Odd Experience”
Reviews.Author: TheJourneyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night of March 7th and our room was clean and basic, I had requested late check-in, king size bed, non-smoking. Room rating: The room was clean, however, the bathroom was strangely small. I paid for a king sized bed and got a room with two queens. Despite the location of our room (right over the driveway, overlooking the freeway), it was relatively quiet and we were able to get a good night's sleep. I should also say, I was thankful for the room being non-smoking! Staff rating: When I asked the chick who checked us in about not having a king-sized bed in the room, she informed me that "when you book online, you get what we have left." ummm, hmmm, okay, weird. Especially since my confirmation specifically said "King sized bed". Of course, it also says in small writing "we'll forward your requests to the property, but there's no guarantee the request will be honored." Nice. But it's the first time my request hasn't been honored. I always request king sized beds, because my husband is 6'6" and I am 5'11". Here was another odd thing, when I was checking in, I went outside to get the license plate number for our car and I couldn't get back into the office because they had locked the door since it was after 11 PM. The chick who was helping me wasn't really paying attention, so there I stood, knocking on the door, trying to get back in to complete the check-in process. It just seemed to me that they could have either waited until everyone who was checking in were done or have the person who locked the door stand at the door until everyone was done. Plus, the chick who was checking me in was all pissy because whoever was supposed to be coming on shift was somewhere else taking a personal call on her cell phone. Wasn't my issue, so don't take it out on me! Amenities: When we left in the morning, the pool looked lovely and I almost wished that we were staying there for the day. There was a little area underneath the stairs that looked like a nice place to gather for conversation or relaxing out of the sun. Overall: This hotel was... okay, but odd. I don't know. I mean, I guess I'd stay there again, the price was right, but it was kind of a weird experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fluffy1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. The room was clean and more than adequate for what we needed. The bathroom, tho teeny, was functional and clean (and its a bathroom, what more do you really want!!!!!). Hot water on demand and a shower.....tho if your tall the shower could prove interesting lol The pool was warm and clean, lots of fun and a spa pool as well tho the water is very warm so avoid if you get sunburnt (as I did and found out!). The staff on the front desk were great (except a grumpy blonde woman, who seemed like everything to her was too much effort). The rest of the staff were great and nothing was too much trouble. The manager was a lovely man who seems to greet everyone with a great big beaming smile. The restaurants, Waffle Spot and Amigo Spot, good standard of food but a little bit pricey, but that seems standard in San Diego is pricey food. For fast food places, go somewhere else as the likes of McD's are virtually non existant in SD, I managed to go 6 days before spottiing a McD's. There is a Subway but its a short bus and trolley ride away (the stop is Morena/Linda Vista) There is a bus stop right outside the hotel but beware on saturdays and sundays its an hourly service (gets to the hotel at approx 20 past the hour) weekdays the service is every 30 minutes, 20 after and 50 after the hour....tho it goes to hourly after 7pm. The trolley is quick and efficient and with the bus and trolley you can be at Old Town transit station in as little as 15 minutes (for more buses and other trolley lines as well as Old Town State park) Old Town state park is great, loads of cool little shops for mexican style souveniers and good food to be found there as well. Shop around for boat and city tours, though the visitors centre (5 mins from USS Midway) sell discounted tickets for tours and also Zoo and Seaworld. Speak to the front desk as they are very good at booking attraction tickets on your behalf. Overall a great hotel which I would stay at again in a heartbeat and a great city which I have EVERY intention of revisiting as soon as I am able.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: deflep116
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and the pool area was a lot of fun. The rooms aren't extremely spacious but they were adequate for our party of four and I liked how they were setup. The overall design is pretty retro but it's clean and there's a couple of restaurants on site. There was ample parking and it's conveniently located. My only complaint was that the morning after the very first night we spent there at 8am the maid came and knocked on our door wanting to know if we needed any service...it was just kind of bizarre. Who needs service the morning after they arrive? All in all, we plan on staying there again next time through San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Retro”
Reviews.Author: Prplpoet18
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there now 3 times in the past few months. Compared with other options that are too expensive or not classy enough, this little homespun gem continues to hold its own! Throw-back to the 1960's-era motor hotel, it is clean and the restaurants are excellent! The Waffle Spot has the best well-done hash browns ever! The Amigo Spot was a pleasant surprise; on Friday night the Mariachis were top-notch and the food delicious (Enchiladas Suiza). I have found all the staff to be courteous & friendly. The bathroom is very small, the towels too thin & tiny, but the shower is decent. There's no elevator to get your luggage upstairs, but they will call someone to help you. A few times lightbulbs and the remote haven't worked and I had to call until someone finally came--but they always come and are polite. We stay there when we are in all-day trainings and just need a place to sleep; it's not a resort but it is reasonable and within 10 minutes of Misson Bay. A good choice for us and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for Price”
Reviews.Author: Tubes11
Reviews.Content: Four adults stayed in a double queen room for one week and we were satisfied with our stay. The beds were a little too hard for my taste, but the rest of our group was fine with them. Have no complaints !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent!”
Reviews.Author: marjur
Reviews.Content: Great location, Hotel circle. many hotels around only 1 Liquor mini market around. My husband and I walked to Old Town San Diego(about1.5mile) hotel is under remodeling process, but we did not felt any noise. we had breakfast @ the hotels resturant found it a little $$, we had breakfast @ Ruby's Dinner for less. did my reservation thru San Diego.org, everything you need to plan your trip. hotel personal SUPER nice. the San Diego bus system stops right in front of the hotel, and the train station is located it in old town.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms smelt musty”
Reviews.Author: Helen25
Reviews.Content: cheaper looking than I thought it'd be. Nice friendly bar with a happy hour - which is always good! 10 minutes drive to main San Diego, but really is located JUST off main busy road (as all the hotels in this area are). Would have been an average, OK room, but all 3 rooms that we had smelt really musty. Even with the air con on all night - it didn't shift the smell. Apart from that, it seemed OK, but just stayed 1 night. Next time would stay in the town near the bars and restaurants - looked a better area

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean Motel”
Reviews.Author: straffevrouw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. The frontdesk was very friendly. We had a large room on the first floor. comfi bed, slept well. The bathroom/shower was small but functional. The room is nothing special but a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice affordable Motel”
Reviews.Author: pilotbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights and found the Kings inn a lot better than stated in some reviews. Reception staff was extremely helpful. Espacially when asking for directions. They had preprinted little cards which guided you to the requested destination in a very easy way. Rooms were a little bit old fashioned, but well maintained and clean.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: ntravellerUk
Reviews.Content: room was good - clean and newish. staff helpful and very good places to eat on site. location not great without a car. trolley/shopping mall 20 mins walk away. 'Mixed' clientele. would pay more and stay downtown next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: bdivalerio
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what it is about this hotel but I really like it and I use it every time I go to San Diego. It's obviously an older hotel, (the pool area looks like the Rat Pack should be hanging out around it) however, it is very well kept up. The rooms are a standard size with an attached vanity area and toilet/shower area. The only flaw is the size of the toilet/shower area which is extremely small. Front desk staff is very pleasant. There are two hotel restaurants (one Mexican and one cafe style) which are very good. In addition, the cost of the rooms is always seems to be much cheaper than the rest of the San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: scruffygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kings Inn for a week, and it was definitely a great value. We booked it because it was cheap, especially compared to other hotels in the area, and we were doing a lot of sightseeing so we weren't even in our room a whole lot during the day (which seemed to be what everyone else was doing too - the place was a ghost town each day by 9 a.m.) The room was clean and simple - my husband says all hotels look the same when you're in the room, and he's about right! The walls seemed pretty soundproof, but you do get noise coming in from outside. The best thing about this hotel is that it's less than 10 minutes from everything in San Diego, the exception being the Wild Animal Park which is 30 minutes or so away. The location was extremely convenient. We were able to spend more on other aspects of our vacation - a kayak tour, Dinner with Shamu at Sea World, etc. because we stayed at a cheaper hotel. What a great time! I strongly recommend Rubio's fish tacos, Fred's mexican restaurant, and the happy hour at The Bitter End in the gaslamp quarter. The zoo and Wild Animal Park were amazing and La Jolla is just gorgeous. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Afforable and good”
Reviews.Author: RanyDanny
Reviews.Content: W stayed here for one night while visiting the San Diego area. It's your typical budget motel but I was amazed how clean and big the rooms are. The restaurant on premises has an excellent breakfast and its location close to the Zoo and Sea World makes it a very good choice for an inexpensive yet good stay

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: CambriaDoris
Reviews.Content: We only had two days to spend in San Diego and wanted to be close to the sights. Our room was very clean and had been remodeled. It had a mildew smell, but it went away after awhile. The pool and jazucci were very nice. The room does not have a coffee maker or hair dryer, but the desk will loan you a hairdryer and there is coffee in the lobby. A nice touch was if you ask for directions to the sights at the desk, they will give you a slip of paper on how to get where you are going starting from the motel. We were there during Easter week with lots of kids, but our room was very quiet. We would definitely stay there again. We loved Balboa Park and spent the whole day there just visiting the museums. Be sure and take the free trolley in the park.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ColinMac
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night because it was right at the start of Spring Break and the hotels were filling up and we needed to get a room somewhere. Our room was on the freeway side and was really pretty noisy. Everything about the room was generally average. No fridge, no coffee maker... just a basic hotel room. The outdoor hot tub was good, the ice machine needs three hands to use properly, and WiFi works OK eventually. Breakfast at the Waffle Spot was OK but needed the 10% discount that comes with the room to bring the price into line with other places. I was asked for photo ID when I presented a credit card at the till, which was annoying since I had to go out to the car to get a passport. Nobody else needed photo ID for me to buy something and it certainly shouldn't be required for a $20 breakfast. Also, what is with 'non-dairy creamer'? Haven't people in America heard of milk? Complimentary coffee from the lobby is fine if you have milk and sugar to go with it but powdered non-dairy creamer makes the whole exercise pointless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: thecatisaway
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was afraid to stay there alone with my two kids. I was so happy to see how safe the hotel feels, we had a room by the pool, my kyds love the waffle spot, the room was basic, however it was clean. the front desk was great giving me directions to the zoo and sea world, it was great staying there, I'm sure we will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Eh..Good for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: TravelerinAZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK. Like other people said the bathrooms are tiny, my husband was too tall for the shower (he is 5'9) One of the ceiling panels fell off & hit me in the head. They could have cleaned a lot better, dirty doors, walls,etc. The beds were comfy. The property is vintage looking, but kept up well. The Waffle Spot was so-so. Service wasn't great, but the food came quick once our order was finally taken. The Amigo Spot was terrible mexican food. Being from AZ we are used to great, authintic mexican food tho. Location is wonderful, right off the freeway & close to the mall. I would probably stay there again if it was for a few days. Not more than 2 or 3 tho.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a NIGHTMARE!”
Reviews.Author: jetlagnow
Reviews.Content: I have NOTHING good to say about this hotel. It was a total dump! I stay in San Diego a lot (I mean A LOT) and have stayed at a lot of mediocre hotels and a few nice ones... but this was neither. This place is like some Tijuana nightmare. What do I mean by that? Read more below... First, the staff were unfriendly and almost resented having to work. That was the first tip off that something was wrong. The second tip off was the strange smell in the lobby. A super disgusting and cheap room deodorizer that smelled like it came from the 99cent store (in some flavor like LILAC or something very old smelling and too floral). Awful. Okay, I was tired and needed a place to stay and couldn't get on the internet. So I was a walk in. The outside of the place is deceptively retro and tropical. The inside is nothing like that! MAJOR mistake going here. I paid almost a hundred dollars for a room (using AAA -- who by the way should NOT be recommending this dump to anyone!). I was totally ripped off. After I changed rooms from a room that was next to the noisy freeway and which had a window that opened up to a blank wall (nice architecture! .... NOT !)... I was then given a room that was worse. I was told it would be a King and it was a double queen. I was tired and didn't feel like changing rooms again. Started to unpack, went to the bathroom. Saw massive peeling paint and mice feces! (took a photo) There were also strange stains on the carpet that splashed up onto the closet mirrors (and which seemed like it had been there for a while). Unbelievable! No, I am NOT kidding! I tried to ignore it and NOT walk around barefoot for obvious reasons. The room smelt horrible too. Like somebody had died in there. But housekeeping had obviously sprayed OVER the smell with that same gag-inducing air freshner from the lobby! I woke up at 2 am and was choking on the smell and physically got ill from it -- so I had to open a window to air the room out. I KNOW somebody had to have died in this room. It was THAT smell. Horrible. I went down to the soda machine area by the pool to get a soda to calm my stomach and was ripped off by BOTH soda machines which stole my quarters! I finally got one soda after paying for TWO. Obviously someone has rigged the machine to drop coins down into the machine and not into the proper coin area (I noticed this only after I had put in the coins). I know! This is unbelievable. But this is what kind of place this is!I feel COMPELLED to warn people to say away from here! Absolute nightmare in every respect. This is a hotel room that is going for around a hundred bucks too (but should be about $10 for what you get). Total dive. Terrible decor. No coffee maker. No iron even! Dinky little towels that are more like bath cloths and just absolutely unclean and smelly. DO NOT STAY HERE! Unless you are a transient, homeless person or someone who has absolutely no standards. It isn't even the bare bones no nonsense kind of hotel for a tired person for one night. Go to the Vagabond down the street for that (at least that one is CLEAN and the people are friendly). If you have any sense at all and want to enjoy a NICE San Diego hotel, you are going to have to spend a bit more money and go to a different part of town. This place is pure Tijuana standards. Fine for Mexico maybe, but not for San Diego. Oh and this is good. I overheard a girl say that someone's car was carjacked in the lot the same night I was there! Yes! Believe it. Not a safe area. Would rate this hotel an F! ! ! Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: b00mers00ner
Reviews.Content: Great value, they now have free wi-fi in the rooms. Great service, they have little papers with instructions on how to get everywhere. Convenient to everything. Bathrooms are small, and this is no means a Hyatt, but we paid 50 bucks a night . Buy your Sea World and Zoo tickets here, you get two days for the price of one at Sea World and the Zoo ticket adds the sky tram and tour bus at no additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, inexpensive, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: EmbraceThisMoment
Reviews.Content: I was looking for banquet facilities for my parents 50th anniversary and chose the Kings Inn. The staff is very friendly and the lady in charge of setting up the banquet was very kind. We booked multiple rooms and everything was clean and very inexpensive considering the area. Please understand that it is an older hotel. If you're looking to save money this is the place. The anniversary party was perfect. The banquet room, setup, etc. is FREE. All you pay for is the catering. They setup tables, placesettings, dance floor, even decorated, all for just the cost of the food which was good and also reasonably priced. They saved us a ton of money with the banquet. The room isn't too large (max about 50 people I think), but there is room for a dance floor, balcony and a small bar also. There are coupons at [--]

Reviews.Title: “Good get away”
Reviews.Author: sandmat
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there several times. Live in SD and use it as a get away. One of few places with adjoining rooms. Family friendly most of the time. On first stay, adults were drinking in the hot tub. Other than that, rooms are nice and always very clean. Ice, soda and snack machine easy to get to. Nice desk to work at and table to sit at and eat. Room service was good, food arrived hot. Overall have enjoyed my stays here and we plan to stay there in the future when we want to get away from our house.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: eeyore117
Reviews.Content: the rooms were very nice and comfortable and the staff was very helpful and nice to us in every thing we needed. The food was great at both the restrunts and it is nice to have a little store so close to you while there.I will be reckamenting it to others. And if and when I return to the area I will most serently be staying ther agian.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tagster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights in September and really enjoyed it. The hotel is easy to find, just off highway 8 interstate 163. On hotel circle which is signposted on the highway. The reception staff are very helpful. They were excellent when we checked in and gave us some discount vouchers for the Waffle Spot & Amigo. He also gave us a voucher for Macy's giving us 11% off for the five days we were there. We asked for directions a few times while there and each time they gave us a little card with exact directions from the hotel to the place. This was excellent and a really good touch. The room. Pros: Basic but clean. Comfy bed. Thick curtains, quiet, good size, air con. Cons: TV reception wasn't the best. Air con a little noisy. The bathroom door didn't shut properly The pool was large and during the day was really quiet. It did get a little noisy in evening, and is open until 10 so you might want to ask for a room away from it. The Waffle spot had basic food, however service is very slow. They have internet pc's that you need to pay for by the minute .25c for 5 mins. About a few min drive away there are two great shopping malls, Fashion Valley & Mission Valley. These have different styles of shops. The former having the more expensive ones but were both excellent. There is a cinema at the latter one. We went to these malls most evenings as open until 9pm. Seaword & the Zoo are easy to get to as is downtown San Diego although we found parking downtown was difficult. Overall for the money this hotel was brilliant and I would recommend it to anyone who is comfortable with basic hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, just”
Reviews.Author: MaxReheat
Reviews.Content: As the previous review mentioned the 1st thing you notice about the room are the rather musty smell it has, not awful but noticeable still. The rooms were also very dark most of the time and you had to substitute light for privacy. Also if you walked around in bare feet they ended up filthy. The Hotel itself was a bit tricky to find from I8, especially if you followed the hotel circle signs, we found it easier coming off on the following Taylor St exit. If you are staying on the Hotel Circle it is definately an advantage to have a car. Taxis cost about $20 to Downtown and the beach areas although there is a bus stop right outside the hotel. On the plus side the hotel reception staff themselves were very helpful and gave us quite a few tips on activities in the area. The onsite restaurant The Waffle Spot was also a good place to have breakfast. The pool and hot tub area also looked quite nice although we never had time to use it. Hotel Circle is also out of the way of the bums and beggars so no hassle from them either. Not an awful place to stay for the price you pay but it could do with a good cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Musty and Moldy!”
Reviews.Author: smithwilde
Reviews.Content: There were many positive reviews of this place on TripAdvisor so I booked it and suggested it to others. What a mistake. The rooms are so musty and moldy it is hard to breathe! The rug in the room is also filthy. The people there are terrific however. Also the food in the restaurants is very good although the music in the restaurant is very loud, both recorded music and live. I won't stay there again because of the smell in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A few disapointments”
Reviews.Author: ldtazz
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel September 14 and 15. Kings Inn was a little on the small side but we made it work. The hotel was great about working with my family we had 5 rooms with 17 people. It was clean and well kept. The only disapointment was that there were no coffee pots in the rooms. We ate at the waffle spot one morning. The food was good, but the service was extremely slow. The prices were a little on the high side so we got fast food after that.
