The front desk was awesome the night we checked in, they were friendly and made sure we were comfortable in our rooms. The girl that was at the front desk the morning we checked out really acted as if she had better places to be than helping us and she was not really friendly. We will stay here again if it is available the next time we make it to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpfull Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ledj
Reviews.Content: Arrived 6pm and had 3 rooms next to each other on 2nd floor away from highway as request when making booking. Small difference in price for rooms altered immediately upon request. Everywhere I wanted to go, eg shopping, restaurants, seaworld, zoo, Tijuana, the front desk staff had a printout with driving directions. Made getting around so easy. Rooms were average but clean and tidy, some with new matresses. Used the pool, hot tub, laundry, and comp coffee/tea. All clean & tidy. You need a car if staying here as there are only hotel/motels in the area. I would stay here again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: travelchick2
Reviews.Content: Well, after reading some reviews, I was a little skeptic staying here with my two teenagers, but found the place to be a little treasure! Yeah, okay it had some problems, the room did smell a little musty at first, but that disappeared quickly once the air was going!, and the room was a bit small, so what? The pool was great and the hot tub was a decent size, I however am upset that I cancelled my other three nights there to move over to the Marriott Mission Valley and paid so much more!!! When I called back to the King's Inn to see if I could get a room for another night they were booked!!! This was a good location, the price was good, call in person to get the AAA rate, you can't get it on the internet. My only gripe about the pool was that it closed at 10:00 p.m., that is too early when you are gone all day and just want to come back and relax, you just get in the pool/hot tub and have to get out, they come around and lock up the gates at the pool area. No free breakfast but you can get a 10% off coupon to eat at The Waffle Spot right inside the lobby and the waffles are GREAT!!! The staff was so friendly!!! They answered all of my questions and gave out little printed directions. Oh, and by the way....FREE parking!!!! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Creditcardtraveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay for the price. Clean, newly refurbished. Bathrooms are spic and span, room service prompt. Really enjoyed the waffle place downstairs, and how close this hotel was to everything we needed. Close to freeways, other hotels, other restaurants, close to the beach... Everything is accessible within 20 minutes. Friendly service. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect resting place”
Reviews.Author: jagz96
Reviews.Content: Perfect budget hotel. If you're looking to save money, and simply want a place to rest after sightseeing, this place is just right. We stayed for 2 nights while visiting the zoo and sea world. Front staff were very friendly and courtious. The rooms are simple and basic but were clean. A little wear here and there but that should be expected for price. Never felt dirty. The pool was nice size although it was cold especially since it was overcast during our stay. The Waffle Spot was not bad for breakfast but the Amigo spot for dinner was very good. We would stay again. One note is be sure to check windows when you arrive. Ours were not locked when we arrived so Im glad i checked... As long as your not expecting the Ritz (which you shouldnt with the prices) and just want no frills and basic place to rest this place is great

Reviews.Title: “Liked It!”
Reviews.Author: TaniaVioleta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 1st weekend of June 2006. The hotel room was appropriate for the price. It is in proximity to Sea World and Mission Beach, and easy access to freeways. The staff was friendly, nice and helpful. There is also a restaurant within the hotel with great food. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget. I'd stay here again. The hotel was a lot better than I pictured it. =)

Reviews.Title: “funny place but fine!!”
Reviews.Author: konatraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April for 4 nights. The location was ok although noise from the highway was quite bad. Actually that didnt seem to bad once we moved rooms come to think of it. We started off on the upper floor in a corner but the noise from pipes or some creature in the loft was too much and we moved rooms at 3a.m!! The guy at reception was really helpful, gave us a key to another room and said to just move our stuff in the morning. We were then on the ground floor near the pool, actually this room was much nicer, slightly bigger and much more natural light. Maybe bear this in mind when booking a room. Funny decor, well it made us giggle anyway, lovley blue bed covers and curtains with nice pink roses on!! Very clean and comfortable though. We used the waffle spot for breakfast which was lovely. We did venture into the bar one early evening, but ,mmmmmm, well how to put it..........have you seen 'My name is Earl' on t.v? The laundry room for guests to do their own washing was very useful. The staff here were really helpful and polite. Overall good value for money.

HotelInfo.Name: Kings Inn Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1333 Hotel Circle South, San Diego, CA 92108
